Files

fluxencrypt/env/
secrets.rs

1//! Secret handling and format detection for environment variables.
2//!
3//! This module provides types and functions for working with secrets loaded
4//! from environment variables, including automatic format detection and
5//! conversion to cryptographic keys.
6
7use crate::error::{FluxError, Result};
8use crate::keys::{PrivateKey, PublicKey};
9use base64::{engine::general_purpose::STANDARD as BASE64, Engine};
10use zeroize::ZeroizeOnDrop;
11
12/// Supported secret formats in environment variables
13#[derive(Debug, Clone, Copy, PartialEq, Eq)]
14pub enum SecretFormat {
15    /// Raw string value
16    Raw,
17    /// Base64 encoded value
18    Base64,
19    /// PEM format (with headers)
20    Pem,
21    /// Hexadecimal encoded value
22    Hex,
23    /// File path pointing to the secret
24    FilePath,
25}
26
27/// A secret loaded from an environment variable
28#[derive(ZeroizeOnDrop)]
29pub struct EnvSecret {
30    /// The raw secret data
31    data: Vec<u8>,
32    /// The detected or specified format
33    #[zeroize(skip)]
34    format: SecretFormat,
35    /// The original string value (for debugging)
36    #[zeroize(skip)]
37    original: String,
38}
39
40impl std::fmt::Debug for EnvSecret {
41    fn fmt(&self, f: &mut std::fmt::Formatter<'_>) -> std::fmt::Result {
42        f.debug_struct("EnvSecret")
43            .field("format", &self.format)
44            .field("data_len", &self.data.len())
45            .field("original_len", &self.original.len())
46            .finish()
47    }
48}
49
50impl EnvSecret {
51    /// Create a new secret from raw data
52    pub fn new(data: Vec<u8>, format: SecretFormat, original: String) -> Self {
53        Self {
54            data,
55            format,
56            original,
57        }
58    }
59
60    /// Create a secret from a string with automatic format detection
61    pub fn from_string(value: String) -> Result<Self> {
62        let format = Self::detect_format(&value);
63        Self::from_string_with_format(value, format)
64    }
65
66    /// Create a secret from a string with a specified format
67    pub fn from_string_with_format(value: String, format: SecretFormat) -> Result<Self> {
68        let data = match format {
69            SecretFormat::Raw => Self::decode_raw(&value),
70            SecretFormat::Base64 => Self::decode_base64(&value)?,
71            SecretFormat::Hex => Self::decode_hex(&value)?,
72            SecretFormat::Pem => Self::decode_pem(&value),
73            SecretFormat::FilePath => Self::read_from_file(&value)?,
74        };
75
76        Ok(Self::new(data, format, value))
77    }
78
79    /// Decode raw string data
80    fn decode_raw(value: &str) -> Vec<u8> {
81        value.as_bytes().to_vec()
82    }
83
84    /// Decode base64 string data
85    fn decode_base64(value: &str) -> Result<Vec<u8>> {
86        BASE64
87            .decode(value)
88            .map_err(|e| FluxError::invalid_input(format!("Invalid base64: {}", e)))
89    }
90
91    /// Decode hexadecimal string data
92    fn decode_hex(value: &str) -> Result<Vec<u8>> {
93        let clean_value = value.trim();
94        if clean_value.len() % 2 != 0 {
95            return Err(FluxError::invalid_input("Hex string must have even length"));
96        }
97
98        let mut result = Vec::with_capacity(clean_value.len() / 2);
99        for chunk in clean_value.as_bytes().chunks(2) {
100            let hex_str = std::str::from_utf8(chunk)
101                .map_err(|_| FluxError::invalid_input("Invalid hex characters"))?;
102            let byte = u8::from_str_radix(hex_str, 16)
103                .map_err(|_| FluxError::invalid_input("Invalid hex characters"))?;
104            result.push(byte);
105        }
106        Ok(result)
107    }
108
109    /// Decode PEM format data
110    fn decode_pem(value: &str) -> Vec<u8> {
111        value.as_bytes().to_vec() // PEM is text-based
112    }
113
114    /// Read secret data from file
115    fn read_from_file(value: &str) -> Result<Vec<u8>> {
116        std::fs::read(value).map_err(|e| {
117            FluxError::invalid_input(format!("Cannot read secret file {}: {}", value, e))
118        })
119    }
120
121    /// Detect the format of a secret string
122    pub fn detect_format(value: &str) -> SecretFormat {
123        // Check for PEM format
124        if value.starts_with("-----BEGIN") && value.contains("-----END") {
125            return SecretFormat::Pem;
126        }
127
128        // Check for file path (contains / or \)
129        if value.contains('/') || value.contains('\\') {
130            return SecretFormat::FilePath;
131        }
132
133        // Check for hex (all characters are hex digits)
134        if value.len() > 10 && value.chars().all(|c| c.is_ascii_hexdigit()) {
135            return SecretFormat::Hex;
136        }
137
138        // Check for base64 (ends with = padding and contains base64 chars)
139        if value.len() > 10
140            && (value.ends_with('=') || value.ends_with("=="))
141            && value
142                .chars()
143                .all(|c| c.is_ascii_alphanumeric() || c == '+' || c == '/' || c == '=')
144        {
145            return SecretFormat::Base64;
146        }
147
148        // Default to raw
149        SecretFormat::Raw
150    }
151
152    /// Get the secret data as bytes
153    pub fn as_bytes(&self) -> &[u8] {
154        &self.data
155    }
156
157    /// Get the secret format
158    pub fn format(&self) -> SecretFormat {
159        self.format
160    }
161
162    /// Get the original string value (for debugging)
163    pub fn original(&self) -> &str {
164        &self.original
165    }
166
167    /// Convert the secret to a string (if it contains valid UTF-8)
168    pub fn as_string(&self) -> Result<String> {
169        String::from_utf8(self.data.clone())
170            .map_err(|e| FluxError::invalid_input(format!("Secret contains invalid UTF-8: {}", e)))
171    }
172
173    /// Convert the secret to a public key
174    pub fn as_public_key(&self) -> Result<PublicKey> {
175        match self.format {
176            SecretFormat::Pem => {
177                // Parse PEM format
178                let pem_str = self.as_string()?;
179                crate::keys::parsing::parse_public_key_from_str(&pem_str)
180            }
181            _ => {
182                // Try to parse as PEM first, then other formats
183                if let Ok(pem_str) = self.as_string() {
184                    if let Ok(key) = crate::keys::parsing::parse_public_key_from_str(&pem_str) {
185                        return Ok(key);
186                    }
187                }
188
189                // TODO: Try other formats (DER, etc.)
190                Err(FluxError::invalid_input(
191                    "Cannot parse secret as public key",
192                ))
193            }
194        }
195    }
196
197    /// Convert the secret to a private key
198    pub fn as_private_key(&self) -> Result<PrivateKey> {
199        match self.format {
200            SecretFormat::Pem => {
201                // Parse PEM format
202                let pem_str = self.as_string()?;
203                crate::keys::parsing::parse_private_key_from_str(&pem_str)
204            }
205            _ => {
206                // Try to parse as PEM first, then other formats
207                if let Ok(pem_str) = self.as_string() {
208                    if let Ok(key) = crate::keys::parsing::parse_private_key_from_str(&pem_str) {
209                        return Ok(key);
210                    }
211                }
212
213                // TODO: Try other formats (DER, PKCS#8, etc.)
214                Err(FluxError::invalid_input(
215                    "Cannot parse secret as private key",
216                ))
217            }
218        }
219    }
220
221    /// Convert the secret to base64
222    pub fn to_base64(&self) -> String {
223        BASE64.encode(&self.data)
224    }
225
226    /// Convert the secret to hex
227    pub fn to_hex(&self) -> String {
228        self.data.iter().map(|b| format!("{:02x}", b)).collect()
229    }
230
231    /// Check if the secret is empty
232    pub fn is_empty(&self) -> bool {
233        self.data.is_empty()
234    }
235
236    /// Get the length of the secret data
237    pub fn len(&self) -> usize {
238        self.data.len()
239    }
240}
241
242/// Utility function to load a secret from an environment variable
243pub fn load_env_secret(var_name: &str) -> Result<EnvSecret> {
244    let value = std::env::var(var_name)
245        .map_err(|_| FluxError::env(format!("Environment variable not found: {}", var_name)))?;
246
247    EnvSecret::from_string(value)
248}
249
250/// Utility function to load a secret with a specific format
251pub fn load_env_secret_with_format(var_name: &str, format: SecretFormat) -> Result<EnvSecret> {
252    let value = std::env::var(var_name)
253        .map_err(|_| FluxError::env(format!("Environment variable not found: {}", var_name)))?;
254
255    EnvSecret::from_string_with_format(value, format)
256}
257
258#[cfg(test)]
259mod tests {
260    use super::*;
261
262    #[test]
263    fn test_format_detection() {
264        // Test PEM detection
265        let pem_value = "-----BEGIN RSA PUBLIC KEY-----\nMIIBIjANBgkqhkiG9w0BAQEFAAOCAQ8A...\n-----END RSA PUBLIC KEY-----";
266        assert_eq!(EnvSecret::detect_format(pem_value), SecretFormat::Pem);
267
268        // Test file path detection
269        assert_eq!(
270            EnvSecret::detect_format("/path/to/file"),
271            SecretFormat::FilePath
272        );
273        assert_eq!(
274            EnvSecret::detect_format("C:\\path\\to\\file"),
275            SecretFormat::FilePath
276        );
277
278        // Test hex detection
279        let hex_value = "abcdef1234567890abcdef1234567890";
280        assert_eq!(EnvSecret::detect_format(hex_value), SecretFormat::Hex);
281
282        // Test base64 detection
283        let b64_value = "SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ=";
284        assert_eq!(EnvSecret::detect_format(b64_value), SecretFormat::Base64);
285
286        // Test raw detection
287        assert_eq!(EnvSecret::detect_format("hello world"), SecretFormat::Raw);
288    }
289
290    #[test]
291    fn test_raw_secret() {
292        let secret =
293            EnvSecret::from_string_with_format("hello world".to_string(), SecretFormat::Raw)
294                .unwrap();
295
296        assert_eq!(secret.as_bytes(), b"hello world");
297        assert_eq!(secret.format(), SecretFormat::Raw);
298        assert_eq!(secret.as_string().unwrap(), "hello world");
299    }
300
301    #[test]
302    fn test_base64_secret() {
303        let secret = EnvSecret::from_string_with_format(
304            "SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ=".to_string(),
305            SecretFormat::Base64,
306        )
307        .unwrap();
308
309        assert_eq!(secret.as_bytes(), b"Hello World");
310        assert_eq!(secret.format(), SecretFormat::Base64);
311    }
312
313    #[test]
314    fn test_hex_secret() {
315        let secret = EnvSecret::from_string_with_format(
316            "48656c6c6f20576f726c64".to_string(),
317            SecretFormat::Hex,
318        )
319        .unwrap();
320
321        assert_eq!(secret.as_bytes(), b"Hello World");
322        assert_eq!(secret.format(), SecretFormat::Hex);
323    }
324
325    #[test]
326    fn test_secret_conversions() {
327        let secret = EnvSecret::from_string("Hello World".to_string()).unwrap();
328
329        assert_eq!(secret.to_base64(), "SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ=");
330        assert_eq!(secret.to_hex(), "48656c6c6f20576f726c64");
331        assert!(!secret.is_empty());
332        assert_eq!(secret.len(), 11);
333    }
334}
